repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**refactor: remove redundant copy in statuscolumn items**

Immediately write to buf_tmp instead of to another temporary buffer that
is later copied to buf_tmp. Misc cleanup.

**feat(column)!: rework 'statuscolumn' %r/l items**

Problem:  A custom 'statuscolumn' needs to check a bunch of options and
          placed signs to replicate the default number column.
Solution: Rework %l item to include the necessary logic to mimic the
          default number column. Remove now redundant %r item.

Fix #21788

comment_data.body: This change should be moved to the first commit.
The name of this variable is a bit confusing.

Why do `lnum` and `relnum` have the same value here? Shouldn't it be like this?
```suggestion
    int width = build_statuscol_str(wp, wp->w_nrwidth_line_count, wp->w_height_inner, buf, stcp);
```

That doesn't work for 'relativenumber' + 'number' where the line count will only be substituted for this estimation when `relnum == 0`, like before. Whereas `relnum == 0` does not yield the right width when the window height is larger than the line count.

I think this together with the logic for the %l item always yields the largest possible width that may be used somewhere in the window.
Maybe this test should use `v:lnum` instead of `%l` now?

comment_regular_data.body: Can you add some description to the commit message of the first commit?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(column)!: rework 'statuscolumn' %r/l items
